== Problem ==
----
Send an Ajax GET request


== Solution ==
--------------
{{{
<html>
<head>
<script src="brython.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
<div id="result">(empty)</div>

<script type="text/python">
def on_complete(req):
    if req.status==200 or req.status==0:
        doc["result"].html = req.text
    else:
        doc["result"].html = "error "+req.text

req = ajax()
req.on_complete = on_complete
req.open('GET', url, True)
req.set_header('content-type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded')
req.send(data)
</script>
</body>
</html>
}}}

The request is an instance of the class `ajax`

The callback function to call when the server has sent the response is attached to the request by setting `req.on_complete` to a function taking a single argument, the request object itself

In the callback function, the request object has 2 useful attributes, the response status (`req.status`) and the response text (`req.text`)
